title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 10, 2019).

Turkey began a military offensive in Syria to seize territory held by U.S.-backed Kurdish forces, opening a new front in the war-ravaged country and drawing a renewed defense by Trump of his decision to shift American troops out of the area.

Trump said he would participate in the House impeachment probe if the investigation were authorized by a House vote and if Democrats commit to following rules he views as fair. Biden called for his impeachment.

German authorities arrested a man suspected of killing two people near a synagogue in the country's east and live streaming the assault.

Senior U.S. and Chinese officials will square off for trade talks Thursday at a pivotal moment in the countries' relationship.

A U.S. counterterrorism analyst was arrested at the DIA and charged with leaking classified information to two journalists.

Facebook's Zuckerberg is slated to return to Capitol Hill this month to testify about the company's foray into cryptocurrency.

Purdue Pharma's settlement plan is contingent on first resolving DOJ probes, court filings show.

The Nobel in chemistry was awarded to three scientists for their work developing lithium-ion batteries.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 10, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
